item.title: Regulatory & Compliance Professional
item.description:
Location: Leeds | Department: Business Services | Salary: £35000 - £45,000

Regulatory & Compliance Professional

A brand new and rare opportunity has arisen here at Optima Legal to join us as a regulatory and compliance professional. You will be dealing with BAU regulatory issues affecting the business including SRA requirements, DPA, AML/Bribery, as well as managing and supporting the firm’s and wider Group’s risk management framework.

Candidates should be able to demonstrate working in an FCA or SRA regulated business and will have experience of working with established risk management frameworks and complex governance arrangements perhaps as part of a wider assurance function. We operate on a three lines of defence basis and so the candidate will have experience of working with a variety of stakeholders within the business internally and externally.  Specific duties will include.

•             SRA Code of Conduct - dealing with queries from the business including managing conflicts of interests; investigating breaches and escalation of issues. Supporting the head of compliance with formulating and monitoring of the firm’s policy.

•             Dealing with DPA and AML queries from the business and escalating as required to the MLRO; supporting dealing with Subject Access Requests.

•             Monitoring and reporting on key regulatory developments; assisting the head of compliance in implementation of regulatory/process changes; drafting change requests as     appropriate.

•             Risk Management - liaising with operations, the Exec and Group to manage the risk framework, reporting on key issues and trend analysis and providing input into the firm’s risk dashboard.

 

Experience required:

You will be educated to degree level. A professional qualification is desirable but not essential with the right experience. You must have experience of working in an advisory role, have good problem solving skills and be well organised and commercially focussed.

 

Skills required:

•             Well organised and commercially focussed on how to manage regulatory requirements in a way which will achieve the company’s goals and objectives.

•             Excited by change, able to gain the confidence of the business through effective decision making and communication.

•             A clear communicator that presents information to the business in a way they engage with and understand, encouraging others

•             Willing to roll your sleeves up, put yourself out for others, with a focus on what matters to the business.

Reports to: Principal Solicitor – Professional Standards

 

Application

As part of our candidate care process we aim to respond to all applications within 7 working days. If you have not been contacted within this timescale your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion.

 

About Us

We are an award winning national law firm, providing debt recovery and legal property services to UK businesses for over 25 years.

We are a wholly owned subsidiary of Capita plc and in May 2014, were granted Alternative Business Structure (ABS) status. We are the future of what a modern law firm should look like.

Our firm is on an exciting journey and we’re looking for highly motivated and committed individuals to join us. Our remortgage department acts for the UK’s leading lenders and has a reputation for delivering high quality client and customer service. If you’d like to part of this award winning team then we’d love to hear from you.

item.title: Litigation Case Executive
item.description:
Location: Leeds | Department: Standard Litigation | Salary: Competitive

An exciting opportunity has arisen for case executives to join the standard Litigation department based in Leeds City Centre.
Main Duties and responsibilities:

Role Specific

1.Service:
• Ensure we deliver to agreed service measures;
• Advise client of available options and commercial implications.
• Prepare and deal with outgoing correspondence tailored to client's specific requirements.
• Check and dispatch legal proceedings.
• Instruct solicitor agents to attend hearings.
• Instruct trace agents to locate defendants.
• Ensure the client is kept up to date with all matters by way of reports, correspondence and telephone calls.
• Ensure case management system reflective of current position of case.
• Ensure cases are progressed proactively and effectively, seeking advice and or direction where appropriate.
• Deal with complex and demanding clients.

2. Processes
• Have an in depth knowledge of Liberate and client view systems and able to identify errors in either system.
• Is competent in dealing with the process which needs to be followed to issue proceedings including the pre-issue checks which need to be undertaken before proceeding
• In depth level understanding on the different legal entities against which legal action can be brought and is aware of the rules for service upon each of these
• Can competently respond appropriately to standard and complex communication from defendants or third parties in respect of the court proceedings
• In depth understanding of the CPC and CCBC and how they process legal proceedings and the ability to troubleshoot should problems arise. Has an understanding of the Secure Data Transfer functionality.
• In depth understanding on what action to take when proceedings are returned unserved and the time limits which apply, and is able to make appropriate applications to court to extend those limits
• Assist in the testing of new and/or existing processes.
• Have a in depth knowledge of enforcement action to include:
• Warrant of execution
• Order to obtain information
• Attachment of earnings
• Charging order (Bulk and standard process)
• Is able to deal with complications arising from enforcement action undertaken

3.Enhanced technical knowledge
• Have a high level working knowledge of the following processes
• Third part debt orders
• Return of goods (understand what the purposes of this enforcement is)
• Factoring debts (understand the concept and how an invoice is assigned under a factoring agreement)
• Late payment interest (Awareness of legislation and rate applied above Bank of England Base Rate and how to apply it)
• Defended/Complex cases (understands who deals with these at Optima and what constitutes defended/complex matters). Also able to ensure when file returned to undefended the file is amended to reflect the order obtained
• Consumer credit act (understanding of what a CCA regulated agreement is and what each parties obligations are)
• Mortgage shortfall (understand how this occurs and aware of legislation and previous court action which may affect the next action taken, i.e. was a money judgment obtained in the possession proceedings?)
• Commission Claw back (understand how this occurs and be aware of legislation)
• Mistaken Payment (understand how this occurs and be aware of legislation)
• Insolvency/bankruptcy implications/stat demands/bankruptcy proceedings/cost assessment/processes (able to confidently undertake all straight forward insolvency proceedings and aware of when a case needs to be escalated in the event of complications)
• Undertakings (understanding of process required when being asked for one or asking for one)

4.Quality & Compliance
• Ensure adherence to Optima policies
• Act in accordance with all the regulatory/ legal requirements within your department
• Complete all e-learning tests and refreshers in a timely manner
• Achieve quality results in line with expectations
• Assist in coaching of Admin’s and CE1’s.

5.Financial
• Work towards achieving financial targets set for the team
• Not to make errors which have a financial impact
• Understand the commercial viability of actions we take on cases

6.General
• Ensure you meet with the Optima Legal values as determined by your departments objectives/SLA's.
• Be aware of your responsibility to be flexible and adaptable across the company to meet the needs of the business.
• Work with other departments to ensure the smooth flow of documents across the business
• Deal with any ad-hoc tasks as required
• Able to follow enforcement processes that they may not deal with on a day-to-day basis.

Experience Required:

• Minimum of 6 months working in a similar role
• Working knowledge of MS Office packages inc. word, excel & outlook
• Team player
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• Good organisation skills
• Ability to prioritise
• Ability to use initiative
• Excellent telephone skills and experience of dealing with customers

Skills

The successful candidate must have excellent client care skills and should be highly organised and confident. In addition, they must possess a pro-active approach and a "can do" attitude. They should have excellent communication skills to be able to deal with a variety of different parties ranging from clients to stakeholders.

Application
As part of our candidate care process we aim to respond to all applications within 7 working days. If you have not been contacted within this timescale your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion.

Benefits
From our city centre locations, we offer a competitive salary and benefits package including a Pension Scheme and subsidised travel.

item.title: Litigation Executive
item.description:
Location: Leeds | Department: Standard Litigation | Salary: upto £16500

 

Optima Legal is in a “race to the top”

 

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Collections Case Executive to join the Recoveries Department based in Leeds City Centre.

 

The post holder will assist with undertaking the recoveries strategy for each client and take the appropriate actions within the service level agreements.

 

Main Duties and responsibilities:

 

Role Specific

 

1. Service:

 

·         Ensure we deliver to agreed service measures;

 

·         Advise client of available options and commercial implications.

 

·         Prepare and deal with outgoing correspondence tailored to client's specific requirements.

 

·         Check and dispatch legal proceedings.

 

·         Instruct solicitor agents to attend hearings.

 

·         Instruct trace agents to locate defendants.

 

·         Ensure the client is kept up to date with all matters by way of reports, correspondence and telephone calls.

 

·         Ensure case management system reflective of current position of case.

 

·         Ensure cases are progressed proactively and effectively, seeking advice and or direction where appropriate.

 

·         Deal with complex and demanding clients.

 

2. Processes

 

·         Have an in depth knowledge of Liberate and client view systems and able to identify errors in either system.

 

·         Is competent in dealing with the process which needs to be followed to issue proceedings including the pre-issue checks which need to be undertaken before proceeding

 

·         In depth level understanding on the different legal entities against which legal action can be brought and is aware of the rules for service upon each of these

 

·         Can competently respond appropriately to standard and complex communication from defendants or third parties in respect of the court proceedings

 

·         In depth understanding of the CPC and CCBC and how they process legal proceedings and the ability to troubleshoot should problems arise. Has an understanding of the Secure Data Transfer functionality.

 

·         In depth understanding on what action to take when proceedings are returned unserved and the time limits which apply, and is able to make appropriate applications to court to extend those limits

 

·         Assist in the testing of new and/or existing processes.

 

·         Have a in depth knowledge of enforcement action to include:

 

§  Warrant of execution

 

§  Order to obtain information

 

§  Attachment of earnings

 

§  Charging order (Bulk and standard process)

 

·         Is able to deal with complications arising from enforcement action undertaken

 

3. Enhanced technical knowledge

 

·         Have a high level working knowledge of the following processes

 

§  Third part debt orders

 

§  Return of goods (understand what the purposes of this enforcement is)

 

§  Factoring debts (understand the concept and how an invoice is assigned under a factoring agreement)

 

§  Late payment interest (Awareness of legislation and rate applied above Bank of England Base Rate and how to apply it)

 

§  Defended/Complex cases (understands who deals with these at Optima and what constitutes defended/complex matters). Also able to ensure when file returned to undefended the file is amended to reflect the order obtained

 

§  Consumer credit act (understanding of what a CCA regulated agreement is and what each parties obligations are)

 

§  Mortgage shortfall (understand how this occurs and aware of legislation and previous court action which may affect the next action taken, i.e. was a money judgment obtained in the possession proceedings?)

 

§  Commission Claw back (understand how this occurs and be aware of legislation)

 

§  Mistaken Payment (understand how this occurs and be aware of legislation)

 

§  Insolvency/bankruptcy implications/stat demands/bankruptcy proceedings/cost assessment/processes (able to confidently undertake all straight forward insolvency proceedings and aware of when a case needs to be escalated in the event of complications)

 

§  Undertakings (understanding of process required when being asked for one or asking for one)

 

4. Quality & Compliance

 

·         Ensure adherence to Optima policies

 

·         Act in accordance with all the regulatory/ legal requirements within your department

 

·         Complete all e-learning tests and refreshers in a timely manner

 

·         Achieve quality results in line with expectations

 

·         Assist in coaching of Admin’s and CE1’s.

 

5. Financial

 

·         Work towards achieving financial targets set for the team

 

·         Not to make errors which have a financial impact

 

·         Understand the commercial viability of actions we take on cases

 

6. General

 

·         Ensure you meet with the Optima Legal values as determined by your departments objectives/SLA's.

 

·         Be aware of your responsibility to be flexible and adaptable across the company to meet the needs of the business.

 

·         Work with other departments to ensure the smooth flow of documents across the business

 

·         Deal with any ad-hoc tasks as required

 

Able to follow enforcement processes that they may not deal with on a day-to-day basis.

 

 

 

Experience Required:        

 

  • Minimum of 18 months working in a similar role

 

·         Working knowledge of MS Office packages inc. word, excel & outlook

 

·         Team player

 

·         Good written and verbal communication skills

 

·         Good organisation skills

 

·         Ability to prioritise

 

·         Ability to use initiative

 

·         Excellent telephone skills and experience of dealing with customers

 

 

 

 

 

Skills

 

The successful candidate must have excellent client care skills and should be highly organised and confident. In addition, they must possess a pro-active approach and a "can do" attitude. They should have excellent communication skills to be able to deal with a variety of different parties ranging from clients to stakeholders.

 

Application

 

As part of our candidate care process we aim to respond to all applications within 14 working days. If you have not been contacted within this timescale your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion.

 

 

 

Benefits

 

From our city centre locations, we offer a competitive salary and benefits package including a Pension Scheme and subsidised travel.
